Test Case Name: Create release with manual build upload
Steps:
1. POST /api/v1/releases with hasManualBuildUpload: true
2. Verify release created with status: IN_PROGRESS
3. Verify cron job created with stage1Status: PENDING
4. Verify Stage 1 tasks created (4 tasks)
Expected Result: Release created successfully with manual build mode enabled. All Stage 1 tasks in PENDING status.

Test Case Name: Create release with CI/CD build upload
Steps:
1. POST /api/v1/releases with hasManualBuildUpload: false
2. Verify release created with status: IN_PROGRESS
3. Verify cron job created with stage1Status: PENDING
4. Verify Stage 1 tasks created (4 tasks)
Expected Result: Release created successfully with CI/CD build mode enabled. All Stage 1 tasks in PENDING status.

Steps:
1. POST /api/v1/releases with platforms: [ANDROID, IOS]
2. Verify platform-target mappings created for each platform
3. Verify per-platform versions stored
Expected Result: Release created with multiple platforms. Each platform has separate version and target mapping.

Steps:
1. POST /api/v1/releases with autoTransitionToStage2: true
2. Verify cron job has autoTransitionToStage2: true
3. Start release and complete Stage 1
Expected Result: Stage 1 automatically transitions to Stage 2 upon completion.

Steps:
1. POST /api/v1/releases with autoTransitionToStage2: false
2. Verify cron job has autoTransitionToStage2: false
3. Complete Stage 1
Expected Result: Stage 1 pauses at AWAITING_REGRESSION phase. User must manually trigger Stage 2.

Steps:
1. Start release (POST /api/v1/releases/{id}/start)
2. Wait for scheduler tick
3. Verify FORK_BRANCH task status: IN_PROGRESS then COMPLETED
4. Verify branch created in SCM
5. Verify externalData contains branchName and branchUrl
Expected Result: FORK_BRANCH task completes successfully. Branch created in SCM. Task externalData contains branch information.

Steps:
1. Ensure release has PM integration configured
2. Wait for FORK_BRANCH to complete
3. Verify CREATE_PROJECT_MANAGEMENT_TICKET task status: COMPLETED
4. Verify tickets created for each platform in platformTargetMappings
5. Verify projectManagementRunId stored in platform mappings
Expected Result: PM tickets created for each platform. Ticket IDs stored in platform mappings. Task externalData contains ticket information.

Steps:
1. Ensure release has Test Management integration configured
2. Wait for FORK_BRANCH to complete
3. Verify CREATE_TEST_SUITE task status: COMPLETED
4. Verify test runs created for each platform
5. Verify testManagementRunId stored in platform mappings
Expected Result: Test suites created for each platform. Run IDs stored in platform mappings. Task externalData contains test run information.

Steps:
1. Create release with hasManualBuildUpload: true
2. Complete FORK_BRANCH task
3. Verify TRIGGER_PRE_REGRESSION_BUILDS task status: AWAITING_MANUAL_BUILD
4. Upload builds for all platforms (PUT /api/v1/stages/kickoff/builds/{platform})
5. Wait for scheduler tick
6. Verify task status: COMPLETED
7. Verify builds created in builds table
Expected Result: Task waits for manual uploads. After all platforms uploaded
Priority: task completes and creates build records.

Steps:
1. Create release with hasManualBuildUpload: false
2. Complete FORK_BRANCH task
3. Verify TRIGGER_PRE_REGRESSION_BUILDS task status: AWAITING_CALLBACK
4. Verify build records created in builds table with workflowStatus: PENDING
5. Simulate CI/CD callback (POST /api/v1/webhooks/build-callback)
6. Verify build status updated to COMPLETED
7. Verify task status: COMPLETED
Expected Result: Task triggers CI/CD pipeline. Build records created. Callback updates build status and task completes.

Steps:
1. Create release with hasManualBuildUpload: true and platform: ANDROID
2. Upload build for ANDROID (PUT /api/v1/stages/kickoff/builds/ANDROID)
3. Verify entry created in release_uploads table with isUsed: false
4. Wait for scheduler tick
5. Verify upload consumed (isUsed: true) and build created in builds table
Expected Result: Build uploaded successfully. Upload entry created in staging table. Task consumes upload and creates build record.

Steps:
1. Create release with hasManualBuildUpload: true and platforms: [ANDROID, IOS]
2. Upload build for ANDROID
3. Verify task status: AWAITING_MANUAL_BUILD (IOS missing)
4. Upload build for IOS
5. Wait for scheduler tick
6. Verify both uploads consumed and builds created
Expected Result: Task waits until all platforms have uploads. After all uploaded
Priority: task completes and creates builds for all platforms.

Steps:
1. Create release with hasManualBuildUpload: false
2. Trigger TRIGGER_PRE_REGRESSION_BUILDS task
3. Simulate CI/CD callback with success (POST /api/v1/webhooks/build-callback with taskId)
4. Verify build status: COMPLETED, buildUploadStatus: UPLOADED
5. Verify task status: COMPLETED
Expected Result: CI/CD callback received. Build status updated. Task completes successfully.

Steps:
1. Create release with hasManualBuildUpload: false
2. Trigger TRIGGER_PRE_REGRESSION_BUILDS task
3. Simulate CI/CD callback with failure (build status: FAILED)
4. Verify build status: FAILED
5. Verify task status: FAILED
6. Verify release status: PAUSED, pauseType: TASK_FAILURE
Expected Result: CI/CD callback reports failure. Build and task marked as FAILED. Release paused with TASK_FAILURE pause type.

Steps:
1. Create release with autoTransitionToStage2: true
2. Complete all Stage 1 tasks
3. Wait for scheduler tick
4. Verify stage1Status: COMPLETED, stage2Status: IN_PROGRESS
5. Verify phase: REGRESSION
Expected Result: Stage 1 completes. Automatically transitions to Stage 2. Phase changes to REGRESSION.

Steps:
1. Create release with autoTransitionToStage2: false
2. Complete all Stage 1 tasks
3. Wait for scheduler tick
4. Verify stage1Status: COMPLETED, stage2Status: PENDING
5. Verify phase: AWAITING_REGRESSION
6. Manually trigger Stage 2 (POST /api/v1/releases/{id}/trigger-stage2)
7. Verify stage2Status: IN_PROGRESS
Expected Result: Stage 1 completes. Pauses at AWAITING_REGRESSION. Manual trigger starts Stage 2.

Steps:
1. Complete Stage 1
2. Wait for scheduler tick (or trigger Stage 2 manually)
3. Verify regression cycle created with status: NOT_STARTED
4. Verify cycle has isLatest: true
5. Verify Stage 2 tasks created for cycle (4 tasks: CREATE_RC_TAG, CREATE_RELEASE_NOTES, TRIGGER_REGRESSION_BUILDS, optional tasks)
Expected Result: First regression cycle created automatically. Cycle tasks created. Cycle marked as latest.

Steps:
1. Start regression cycle
2. Wait for scheduler tick
3. Verify CREATE_RC_TAG task status: COMPLETED
4. Verify RC tag created in SCM (e.g., v1.0.0_rc_1)
5. Verify cycleTag stored in regression cycle record
Expected Result: RC tag created successfully. Tag stored in cycle record. Task externalData contains tag information.

Steps:
1. Complete CREATE_RC_TAG task
2. Wait for scheduler tick
3. Verify CREATE_RELEASE_NOTES task status: COMPLETED
4. Verify release notes created in SCM
5. Verify externalData contains release notes URL
Expected Result: Release notes created for regression cycle. Notes URL stored in task externalData.

Steps:
1. Complete first regression cycle
2. Create second regression cycle (via scheduled slot or manual)
3. Verify RESET_TEST_SUITE task created for second cycle
4. Wait for scheduler tick
5. Verify RESET_TEST_SUITE task status: COMPLETED
6. Verify test suite reset in Test Management system
Expected Result: RESET_TEST_SUITE task created only for subsequent cycles. Test suite reset successfully.

Steps:
1. Create first regression cycle
2. Verify RESET_TEST_SUITE task NOT created for first cycle
3. Verify only 4 tasks created (no RESET_TEST_SUITE)
Expected Result: RESET_TEST_SUITE task not created for first cycle. Only subsequent cycles have this task.

Steps:
1. Create release with hasManualBuildUpload: true
2. Start regression cycle
3. Upload regression builds for all platforms (PUT /api/v1/stages/regression/builds/{platform})
4. Wait for scheduler tick
5. Verify TRIGGER_REGRESSION_BUILDS task status: COMPLETED
6. Verify builds created with regressionId linked to cycle
Expected Result: Regression builds uploaded manually. Task consumes uploads and creates builds linked to regression cycle.

Steps:
1. Create release with hasManualBuildUpload: false
2. Start regression cycle
3. Verify TRIGGER_REGRESSION_BUILDS task status: AWAITING_CALLBACK
4. Verify build records created with regressionId
5. Simulate CI/CD callback
6. Verify task status: COMPLETED
Expected Result: Regression builds triggered via CI/CD. Builds linked to cycle. Callback completes task.

Steps:
1. Complete all cycle tasks
2. Wait for scheduler tick
3. Verify cycle status: DONE
4. Verify isLatest: false (if new cycle created)
5. Verify all cycle tasks status: COMPLETED
Expected Result: Regression cycle completes successfully. Cycle status updated to DONE. All tasks completed.

Steps:
1. Configure release with 3 regression slots
2. Complete first cycle
3. Wait for second slot time (or trigger manually)
4. Verify second cycle created
5. Complete second cycle
6. Wait for third slot time
7. Verify third cycle created
Expected Result: Multiple regression cycles created at scheduled times. Each cycle has separate tasks and builds.

Steps:
1. Create regression cycle with status: IN_PROGRESS
2. Abandon cycle (POST /api/v1/regression-cycles/{id}/abandon)
3. Verify cycle status: ABANDONED
4. Verify isLatest: false
5. Verify can create new cycle
Expected Result: Regression cycle abandoned successfully. Cycle status updated. New cycle can be created.

Steps:
1. Complete all regression cycles
2. Verify test management status: PASSED (GET /api/v1/test-management-run-status)
3. Verify cherry pick status: cherryPickAvailable: false (GET /api/v1/check-cherry-pick-status)
4. Approve regression (POST /api/v1/trigger-pre-release)
5. Verify stage2Status: COMPLETED, stage3Status: IN_PROGRESS
6. Verify phase: PRE_RELEASE
Expected Result: Regression approval succeeds when all requirements met. Stage 2 completes and Stage 3 starts.

Steps:
1. Complete all regression cycles
2. Set test management status: FAILED
3. Attempt to approve regression
4. Verify approval rejected with error message
5. Verify stage2Status: IN_PROGRESS (not completed)
Expected Result: Regression approval fails when test management not passed. Error message returned. Stage 2 remains in progress.

Steps:
1. Complete all regression cycles
2. Set cherry pick status: cherryPickAvailable: true
3. Attempt to approve regression
4. Verify approval rejected with error message
5. Verify stage2Status: IN_PROGRESS
Expected Result: Regression approval fails when cherry picks available. Error message returned. Stage 2 remains in progress.

Steps:
1. Complete all regression cycles
2. Set test management status: FAILED
3. Approve regression with forceApprove: true (POST /api/v1/trigger-pre-release?forceApprove=true)
4. Verify approval succeeds despite failed requirements
5. Verify stage2Status: COMPLETED
Expected Result: Force approve bypasses validation. Regression approved and Stage 3 starts regardless of requirements.

Steps:
1. Approve regression stage
2. Wait for scheduler tick
3. Verify Stage 3 tasks created (2-4 tasks depending on platforms)
4. Verify tasks: CREATE_RELEASE_TAG, CREATE_FINAL_RELEASE_NOTES, TRIGGER_TEST_FLIGHT_BUILD (if iOS), CREATE_AAB_BUILD (if Android)
Expected Result: Stage 3 tasks created automatically after regression approval. Tasks created based on configured platforms.

Steps:
1. Start Stage 3
2. Wait for scheduler tick
3. Verify CREATE_RELEASE_TAG task status: COMPLETED
4. Verify release tag created in SCM (e.g., v1.0.0)
5. Verify releaseTag stored in release record
6. Verify externalData contains tag information
Expected Result: Release tag created successfully. Tag stored in release record. Task externalData contains tag details.

Steps:
1. Complete CREATE_RELEASE_TAG task
2. Wait for scheduler tick
3. Verify CREATE_FINAL_RELEASE_NOTES task status: COMPLETED
4. Verify final release notes created in SCM
5. Verify externalData contains release notes URL
Expected Result: Final release notes created successfully. Notes URL stored in task externalData.

Steps:
1. Create release with hasManualBuildUpload: true and iOS platform
2. Start Stage 3
3. Verify TRIGGER_TEST_FLIGHT_BUILD task status: AWAITING_MANUAL_BUILD
4. Verify TestFlight build (POST /api/v1/stages/pre-release/builds/ios/verify-testflight)
5. Wait for scheduler tick
6. Verify task status: COMPLETED
7. Verify build created with testflightNumber
Expected Result: TestFlight build verified manually. Task consumes verification and creates build with testflightNumber.

Steps:
1. Create release with hasManualBuildUpload: false and iOS platform
2. Start Stage 3
3. Verify TRIGGER_TEST_FLIGHT_BUILD task status: AWAITING_CALLBACK
4. Verify build record created
5. Simulate CI/CD callback
6. Verify task status: COMPLETED
7. Verify build has testflightNumber
Expected Result: TestFlight build triggered via CI/CD. Callback updates build with testflightNumber. Task completes.

Steps:
1. Create release with hasManualBuildUpload: true and Android platform
2. Start Stage 3
3. Verify CREATE_AAB_BUILD task status: AWAITING_MANUAL_BUILD
4. Upload AAB build (PUT /api/v1/stages/pre-release/builds/ANDROID)
5. Provide internalTrackLink with versionCode
6. Wait for scheduler tick
7. Verify task status: COMPLETED
8. Verify build created with buildNumber from versionCode
Expected Result: AAB build uploaded manually. VersionCode extracted from internalTrackLink. Build created with correct buildNumber.

Steps:
1. Create release with hasManualBuildUpload: false and Android platform
2. Start Stage 3
3. Verify CREATE_AAB_BUILD task status: AWAITING_CALLBACK
4. Verify build record created
5. Simulate CI/CD callback with internalTrackLink
6. Verify task status: COMPLETED
7. Verify build has buildNumber from versionCode
Expected Result: AAB build triggered via CI/CD. Callback updates build with versionCode. Task completes.

Steps:
1. Complete all Stage 3 tasks
2. Check PM approval status (GET /api/v1/project-management-run-status)
3. Verify approval status per platform
4. If not approved, request approval
5. Verify approval status updated
Expected Result: PM approval status checked successfully. Approval can be requested if not already approved.

Steps:
1. Complete all Stage 3 tasks
2. Verify PM approval: approved: true
3. Complete Stage 3 (POST /api/v1/stages/post-regression/complete)
4. Verify stage3Status: COMPLETED
5. Verify phase: AWAITING_SUBMISSION
6. Verify distribution created
Expected Result: Stage 3 completes successfully. Distribution created. Phase changes to AWAITING_SUBMISSION.

Steps:
1. Complete all Stage 3 tasks
2. Verify PM approval: approved: false
3. Attempt to complete Stage 3
4. Verify completion rejected with error message
5. Verify stage3Status: IN_PROGRESS (not completed)
Expected Result: Stage 3 completion fails when PM approval not granted. Error message returned. Stage 3 remains in progress.

Steps:
1. Complete Stage 3
2. Verify distribution created (GET /api/v1/distributions?releaseId={id})
3. Verify distribution has correct platforms and store types
4. Verify submissions created for each platform
Expected Result: Distribution created successfully from release. Submissions created for each platform.

Steps:
1. Complete Stage 3 with Android platform
2. Get distribution and Android submission
3. Submit to Play Store (PUT /api/v1/submissions/{id}/submit?platform=ANDROID)
4. Verify submission status: SUBMITTED
5. Verify release status: SUBMITTED
6. Verify phase: SUBMITTED_PENDING_APPROVAL
Expected Result: Android submission succeeds. Release status updated. Phase changes to SUBMITTED_PENDING_APPROVAL.

Steps:
1. Complete Stage 3 with iOS platform
2. Get distribution and iOS submission
3. Submit to App Store (PUT /api/v1/submissions/{id}/submit?platform=IOS)
4. Verify submission status: SUBMITTED
5. Verify release status: SUBMITTED
6. Verify phase: SUBMITTED_PENDING_APPROVAL
Expected Result: iOS submission succeeds. Release status updated. Phase changes to SUBMITTED_PENDING_APPROVAL.

Steps:
1. Complete Stage 3 with both Android and iOS platforms
2. Submit to both stores
3. Verify both submissions status: SUBMITTED
4. Verify release status: SUBMITTED
Expected Result: Both stores submitted successfully. Release status updated to SUBMITTED.

Steps:
1. Submit to stores
2. Simulate store approval
3. Update release status: COMPLETED (via store callback or manual update)
4. Verify phase: COMPLETED
5. Verify releaseDate set
Expected Result: Release completes after store approval. Release date set. Phase changes to COMPLETED.

Steps:
1. Simulate task failure (integration error)
2. Verify task status: FAILED
3. Verify release status: PAUSED
4. Verify pauseType: TASK_FAILURE
5. Verify cron job pauseType: TASK_FAILURE
Expected Result: Task failure pauses release. Release status and pause type updated correctly.

Steps:
1. Fail a task (task status: FAILED)
2. Retry task (POST /api/v1/tasks/{id}/retry)
3. Verify task status reset to: PENDING
4. Wait for scheduler tick
5. Verify task re-executes
6. Verify task status: COMPLETED
Expected Result: Task retry succeeds. Task status reset and re-executed. Task completes successfully.

Steps:
1. Trigger CI/CD build task
2. Simulate build callback with failure status
3. Verify build status: FAILED
4. Verify task status: FAILED
5. Verify release status: PAUSED
Expected Result: Build callback failure pauses release. Build and task marked as failed. Release paused.

Steps:
1. Create release with hasManualBuildUpload: true
2. Trigger build task
3. Do not upload builds
4. Verify task status: AWAITING_MANUAL_BUILD
5. Verify release status: IN_PROGRESS (not paused)
6. Upload missing builds
7. Verify task completes
Expected Result: Task waits for manual uploads without pausing release. After uploads

Steps:
1. Create release with platforms: [ANDROID, IOS] and hasManualBuildUpload: true
2. Upload build for ANDROID only
3. Verify task status: AWAITING_MANUAL_BUILD
4. Verify missing platforms: [IOS]
5. Upload build for IOS
6. Verify task completes
Expected Result: Task waits for all platforms. Partial uploads keep task in AWAITING_MANUAL_BUILD. After all uploaded

Steps:
1. Start release (status: IN_PROGRESS)
2. Pause release (POST /api/v1/releases/{id}/pause)
3. Verify release status: PAUSED
4. Verify pauseType: USER_REQUESTED
5. Verify cron job pauseType: USER_REQUESTED
6. Verify scheduler skips release
Expected Result: Release paused by user. Status and pause type updated. Scheduler skips paused release.

Steps:
1. Pause release (status: PAUSED)
2. Resume release (POST /api/v1/releases/{id}/resume)
3. Verify release status: IN_PROGRESS
4. Verify pauseType: NONE
5. Verify scheduler processes release
Expected Result: Release resumed successfully. Status updated. Scheduler processes release again.

Steps:
1. Create release (any status)
2. Archive release (POST /api/v1/releases/{id}/archive)
3. Verify release status: ARCHIVED
4. Verify cron job cronStatus: COMPLETED
5. Verify scheduler skips archived release
Expected Result: Release archived successfully. Status updated. Scheduler skips archived release.

Steps:
1. Create release → Verify phase: NOT_STARTED
2. Start release → Verify phase: KICKOFF
3. Complete Stage 1 → Verify phase: AWAITING_REGRESSION or REGRESSION
4. Complete Stage 2 → Verify phase: AWAITING_PRE_RELEASE or PRE_RELEASE
5. Complete Stage 3 → Verify phase: AWAITING_SUBMISSION or SUBMISSION
6. Submit to stores → Verify phase: SUBMITTED_PENDING_APPROVAL
7. Store approval → Verify phase: COMPLETED
Expected Result: All phase transitions work correctly. Phase updates match stage completion and release status.

Steps:
1. Create release with hasManualBuildUpload: true
2. Upload build file (PUT /api/v1/stages/{stage}/builds/{platform})
3. Verify file uploaded to S3
4. Verify entry created in release_uploads table
5. Verify artifactPath stored correctly
Expected Result: Build artifact uploaded successfully. File stored in S3. Upload entry created in staging table.

Steps:
1. Upload build artifact
2. Verify entry in release_uploads with isUsed: false
3. Delete upload (DELETE /api/v1/builds/artifacts/{uploadId})
4. Verify entry deleted from release_uploads table
Expected Result: Unused build upload deleted successfully. Entry removed from staging table.

Steps:
1. Upload build artifact
2. Wait for task to consume upload (isUsed: true)
3. Attempt to delete upload
4. Verify deletion fails with error message
Expected Result: Used build upload cannot be deleted. Error message returned.

Steps:
1. Upload multiple build artifacts
2. List artifacts (GET /api/v1/builds/artifacts?releaseId={id})
3. Verify all uploads returned
4. Verify upload details (platform, stage, isUsed, etc.)
Expected Result: Build artifacts listed successfully. All uploads returned with correct details.

Steps:
1. Upload build artifact
2. Trigger build task
3. Wait for scheduler tick
4. Verify upload isUsed: true
5. Verify usedByTaskId set
6. Verify build created in builds table
Expected Result: Build upload consumed successfully. Upload marked as used. Build record created.

Steps:
1. Configure SCM integration in release config
2. Create release
3. Execute FORK_BRANCH task
4. Verify branch created in SCM repository
5. Verify branch URL returned
Expected Result: SCM integration works. Branch forked successfully. Branch URL returned.

Steps:
1. Configure SCM integration
2. Execute CREATE_RC_TAG or CREATE_RELEASE_TAG task
3. Verify tag created in SCM repository
4. Verify tag URL returned
Expected Result: SCM integration works. Tags created successfully. Tag URLs returned.

Steps:
1. Configure PM integration in release config
2. Create release with platforms
3. Execute CREATE_PROJECT_MANAGEMENT_TICKET task
4. Verify tickets created in PM system
5. Verify ticket IDs stored in platform mappings
Expected Result: PM integration works. Tickets created for each platform. Ticket IDs stored correctly.

Test Case Name: Test Management integration - Create test suite
Steps:
1. Configure Test Management integration
2. Create release with platforms
3. Execute CREATE_TEST_SUITE task
4. Verify test runs created in Test Management system
5. Verify run IDs stored in platform mappings
Expected Result: Test Management integration works. Test suites created for each platform. Run IDs stored correctly.

Steps:
1. Configure CI/CD integration in release config
2. Create release with hasManualBuildUpload: false
3. Execute build task (TRIGGER_PRE_REGRESSION_BUILDS, etc.)
4. Verify workflow triggered in CI/CD system
5. Verify queueLocation returned
6. Verify build record created with workflowStatus: PENDING
Expected Result: CI/CD integration works. Workflow triggered successfully. Build record created with workflow status.

Steps:
1. Create multiple releases with status: IN_PROGRESS
2. Verify all releases have cronStatus: RUNNING, pauseType: NONE
3. Wait for scheduler tick
4. Verify all active releases processed
5. Verify task execution for each release
Expected Result: Global scheduler processes all active releases. Each release's tasks executed correctly.

Steps:
1. Create release and pause it
2. Verify pauseType: USER_REQUESTED or TASK_FAILURE
3. Wait for scheduler tick
4. Verify release not processed
5. Verify tasks remain in current status
Expected Result: Scheduler correctly skips paused releases. Tasks not executed for paused releases.

Steps:
1. Create release and archive it
2. Verify release status: ARCHIVED
3. Wait for scheduler tick
4. Verify release not processed
Expected Result: Scheduler correctly skips archived releases. Archived releases not processed.

Steps:
1. Create release with autoTransitionToStage2: true
2. Complete Stage 1
3. Wait for scheduler tick
4. Verify state machine transitions from KickoffState to RegressionState
5. Verify stage2Status: IN_PROGRESS
Expected Result: State machine transitions correctly. Stage transitions work as expected.

Test Case Name: Create cycle at scheduled slot time
Steps:
1. Configure release with regression slots
2. Complete Stage 1
3. Wait for first slot time
4. Verify cycle created automatically
5. Verify cycle tasks created
Expected Result: Regression cycle created at scheduled slot time. Cycle and tasks created automatically.

Steps:
1. Complete Stage 1
2. Manually create cycle (POST /api/v1/regression-cycles)
3. Verify cycle created with status: NOT_STARTED
4. Verify cycle tasks created
Expected Result: Regression cycle created manually. Cycle and tasks created successfully.

Steps:
1. Create cycle (status: NOT_STARTED)
2. Start cycle execution
3. Verify status: IN_PROGRESS
4. Complete all cycle tasks
5. Verify status: DONE
Expected Result: Regression cycle status transitions correctly. Status updates from NOT_STARTED → IN_PROGRESS → DONE.

Steps:
1. Create first cycle (isLatest: true)
2. Create second cycle
3. Verify first cycle isLatest: false
4. Verify second cycle isLatest: true
Expected Result: Latest cycle tracking works correctly. Only current cycle marked as latest.

Steps:
1. Create regression cycle
2. Execute TRIGGER_REGRESSION_BUILDS task
3. Verify builds created with regressionId matching cycle ID
4. Verify builds linked to cycle
Expected Result: Regression cycle builds linked correctly. Builds have correct regressionId.

Steps:
1. Execute FORK_BRANCH task
2. Verify notification sent (BRANCH_FORKOUT type)
3. Verify notification contains branch name
Expected Result: BRANCH_FORKOUT notification sent after branch fork. Notification contains branch information.

Steps:
1. Execute CREATE_PROJECT_MANAGEMENT_TICKET task
2. Verify notification sent (PROJECT_MANAGEMENT_LINKS type)
3. Verify notification contains ticket URLs for each platform
Expected Result: PROJECT_MANAGEMENT_LINKS notification sent after PM tickets created. Notification contains ticket URLs.

Steps:
1. Execute CREATE_TEST_SUITE task
2. Verify notification sent (TEST_MANAGEMENT_LINKS type)
3. Verify notification contains run URLs for each platform
Expected Result: TEST_MANAGEMENT_LINKS notification sent after test suites created. Notification contains run URLs.

Steps:
1. Create release with invalid platform-target combination
2. Verify creation fails with validation error
3. Create release with valid combinations
4. Verify creation succeeds
Expected Result: Platform-target mapping validation works. Invalid combinations rejected. Valid combinations accepted.

Steps:
1. Create release with invalid version format
2. Verify validation error returned
3. Create release with valid version format
4. Verify creation succeeds
Expected Result: Version format validation works. Invalid formats rejected. Valid formats accepted.

Steps:
1. Attempt to create release without required fields
2. Verify validation errors returned
3. Create release with all required fields
4. Verify creation succeeds
Expected Result: Required field validation works. Missing fields cause validation errors.

Steps:
1. Create 10 releases simultaneously
2. Start all releases
3. Wait for scheduler ticks
4. Verify all releases processed correctly
5. Verify no race conditions or deadlocks
Expected Result: Multiple concurrent releases processed correctly. No race conditions or performance issues.

Steps:
1. Create release with 10 regression cycles
2. Complete all cycles
3. Verify all cycles processed correctly
4. Verify performance acceptable
Expected Result: Release with many regression cycles processed correctly. Performance remains acceptable.

Steps:
1. Create release with only ANDROID platform
2. Verify only Android-specific tasks created in Stage 3
3. Verify no iOS tasks created
Expected Result: Release with single platform works correctly. Only relevant tasks created.

Steps:
1. Create release with WEB platform
2. Verify WEB platform handled correctly
3. Verify no build tasks for WEB
Expected Result: Release with WEB platform handled correctly. WEB platform doesn't require builds.

Steps:
1. Create release without PM or Test Management integrations
2. Verify tasks created without integration-dependent tasks
3. Verify release progresses correctly
